page.title: 16Industrial - history(cont..)
page.content: In 1958 because there were no pits or heavy works at the north end of the valley the railway line closed. It is interesting to note that at one time this line had carried the longest passenger train in the world - the three O'clock from Wylie Oakdale Markham. Some light industries were introduced after the war. Denex Crown Cork 3Ms, Highfield steel and Nut and Bolt. Of these Denex a once prosperous clothing factory has left, Nut. Bolt and Highfield Steel no longer exist, but the remaining two are at this moment still flourishing. However like so many light industries they employ more female than male labour and is very small numbers in comparison to Heavy Industry.
